title: There is a problem with your connection.
body: There is a problem with your connection. If you are not currently connected to the internet, please do so. If you are already on-online but cannot connect to lLeague of Legends, check our support page to find the possible solution. Riot please fix this issue and god bless season 7 is up!

replies.body:
I got mine to work for now follow these steps:

Press the Windows Key (the key on the left side of the spacebar, between ctrl and alt)
Type cmd
Right-click the Command prompt shortcut and select "Run as Administrator" from the drop down menu. You should now see a black window with white letters.
Type ipconfig /release in the command prompt.
Press [Enter]
Type ipconfig /renew in the command prompt.
Press [Enter]
Type ipconfig /flushdns in the command prompt
Press [Enter]
Close the command prompt and attempt to make a connection.
Same here whats going on. It was working fine this morning. Whats happening?
I have the exact same problem: for clarity the error is right when I start up the client, the legacy and beta client are both doing it.
use the hextech repair tool, and check force repatch, it worked for me

This is related to a live service issue that's ongoing. I recommend trying a flush of your DNS as a workaround. If this does not work, I recommend keeping an eye on [**this post**](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/yjteaUkU-login-issues-all-regions-127) where we're tracking this issue.

Let me know if you have any questions.

well i might get a 20 min queue load after that cause game crashed during load game and it been 3 hours i cant open my client.

it says lolclient not responding

Yeah, I have gotten this message a few times these past couple of weeks. I don't know if this helped or it was just a coincidence, but I went into my processes and closed everything relating to league. I then started up the client and I received no error message.

I've been having the same problem, but this fixed it for me.

Press the windows button + R. Type in "cmd" and press enter. This will open the command prompt. From here type "ipconfig /flushdns" and it should work :)
Same problem tried forcing repatch didn't work. SOS
uh just left the client open for like 5 minutes , message went away , queuing up rn

1.Open the Start Menu
2.Open Control Panel
3.Select "Network and Internet"
4.Select "Network and Sharing Center"
5.Select "Change Adapter Settings" on the navigation bar on the left
6.Right click on your network adapter and select "Properties"
7.Select "Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)" and open Properties
8.Go to the bottom of the menu and change "Obtain DNS server address automatically." to "Use the following DNS server addresses:"
9.Put in the following public DNS servers, one in each empty field:
> 8.8.8.8
> 8.8.4.4

10.Save your changes by selecting "OK"

11.Close all open web browsers and applications
12.Press the Windows Key
13.In the Search bar, type command prompt
14.Right click on the result and select "Run as Administrator"
15.In the command prompt, type "ipconfig /flushdns" and press Enter.
16.Restart your computer

Bump because I really don't want to uninstall and install it again.
